str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Belonging to Cyrene, a Cyrenaean. From Kurene; i.e. Cyrenaean, i.e. Inhabitant of Cyrene.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Of foreign origin; properly, to be a courier, i.e. to press into public service.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To raise, lift up, take away, remove.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
